alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola; McKinley; San Juan; Sandoval; Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 26 at 10:23AM MST until February 26 at 10:45AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM MST FOR CENTRAL CIBOLA...NORTHEASTERN MCKINLEY...WESTERN SANDOVAL... NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO...NORTHEASTERN CATRON AND SOUTHEASTERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES... At 1022 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles west of El Huerfano Trading Post to San Mateo to 16 miles southeast of Aragon, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 47 and 111. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 108 and 139. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 39 and 80. Locations impacted include... Grants, Thoreau, Crownpoint, Datil, Milan, Acoma Pueblo, Cebolletita, Nageezi, Bluewater Lake State Park and El Morro. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Catron; Cibola; McKinley; San Juan; Sandoval; Socorro
